description: Software Engineer Iii Securities Trade Management Python | JPMorganChase | Brazil We have an exciting and rewarding opportunity for you to take your software engineering career to the next level. You are responsible for carrying out critical technology solutions across multiple technical areas within various business functions in support of the firm’s business objectives. You will need to work with Operation, Trading desk, Quantitative Research and Technology groups to deliver the technology modernization agenda, improve CEM business workflows and enable the business to capture new frontier emerging market. title: Quantitative Engineer - Financial Modeler
description:
About the Role

We are seeking a skilled Quantitative Engineer to join our team. As a Quantitative Engineer, you will play a critical role in translating financial strategy into production-ready logic.

title: Strategic Quantitative Engineering Specialist
description:
You will play a key role in helping to build scalable portfolio logic that underpins our core platform. As a skilled Quantitative Engineer, you'll work closely with cross-functional teams to translate financial strategy into production-ready code.

About the Role
• Design and implement robust models, tax optimization algorithms, and rebalancing logic
• Create clean, maintainable, and testable Python code aligned with financial goals
• Collaborate with engineering teams to ensure quant logic is scalable and robust
• Work with various data systems, including SQL Server, MongoDB, and DynamoDB
• Document models and decisions in Confluence and collaborate cross-functionally

Your Skills and Qualifications
• A strong background in applied mathematics, financial modeling, or quantitative finance
• Proficiency in Python, with a focus on clarity, testing, and performance
• Experience with AWS serverless tools (e.g., Lambda, Step Functions) is an advantage
• Strong communication skills – able to explain complex models clearly and work closely with both engineers and non-technical stakeholders
• A collaborative mindset with a bias for action and team ownership

Why This Opportunity Matters

You'll be part of a sharp, supportive team solving complex problems that have a direct impact on the future of wealth management. We prioritize clean code, value collaboration, and aim for lasting impact.

Salary: USD 70k -100k per year

title: Optimization Engineer
description:
Portfolio Optimization Specialist

We are seeking a highly skilled Portfolio Optimization Specialist to join our team. As a key member of our engineering group, you will be responsible for designing and implementing portfolio models, tax optimization algorithms, and rebalancing logic.

In this role, you will work closely with our engineering team to ensure that your quant logic is scalable, robust, and production-ready. You will also collaborate with various data systems, including SQL Server, MongoDB, and DynamoDB, and document your models and decisions in Confluence.

To succeed in this position, you will need strong background in applied mathematics, financial modeling, or quantitative finance. Proficiency in Python is required, with a focus on clarity, testing, and performance. Experience with AWS serverless tools, such as Lambda and Step Functions, is a plus.

A strong communication skillset is essential, as you will need to explain complex models clearly to both engineers and non-technical stakeholders. A collaborative mindset with a bias for action and team ownership is also critical.

This is an exciting opportunity to join a sharp, supportive team solving complex problems that directly impact the future of wealth management. We value clean code, aim for lasting impact, and move fast in a dynamic environment.

Key Responsibilities:
• Design and implement portfolio models, tax optimization algorithms, and rebalancing logic.
• Collaborate with engineering to ensure quant logic is scalable, robust, and production-ready.
• Work with a variety of data systems (SQL Server, MongoDB, DynamoDB).
• Document models and decisions in Confluence.

Required Skills and Qualifications:
• Strong background in applied mathematics, financial modeling, or quantitative finance.
• Proficiency in Python, with a focus on clarity, testing, and performance.
• Experience with AWS serverless tools (e.g., Lambda, Step Functions) is a plus.
• Strong communication skills to explain complex models clearly.
• Collaborative mindset with a bias for action and team ownership.
